Annotation.String: The Certificate schema describes a certificate that proves the identify of a component, account, or service.
This resource shall represent a certificate for a Redfish implementation.
Use the DELETE operation to remove certificates.
A Privacy Enhanced Mail (PEM)-encoded certificate.
The format of the certificate shall contain a Privacy Enhanced Mail (PEM)-encoded string, containing RFC5280-defined structures.
A Privacy Enhanced Mail (PEM)-encoded PKCS7 certificate.

The format of the certificate shall contain a Privacy Enhanced Mail (PEM)-encoded string, containing RFC5280- and RFC2315-defined structures. The service can discard additional certificates or other data in the structure.
The usages of a key contained within a certificate.
This type shall describe the usages of a key within a certificate, as specified by the 'Key Usage' and 'Extended Key Usage' definitions in RFC5280.
Verifies digital signatures, other than signatures on certificates and CRLs.
Verifies digital signatures, other than signatures on certificates and CRLs, and provides a non-repudiation service that protects against the signing entity falsely denying some action.
Enciphers private or secret keys.
Directly enciphers raw user data without an intermediate symmetric cipher.
Key agreement.
Verifies signatures on public key certificates.
Verifies signatures on certificate revocation lists (CRLs).
Enciphers data while performing a key agreement.
Deciphers data while performing a key agreement.
TLS WWW server authentication.
TLS WWW client authentication.
Signs downloadable executable code.
Email protection.
Binds the hash of an object to a time.
Signs OCSP responses.
This action generates a new key-pair for a certificate and produces a certificate signing request.

This action shall use the certificate data to generate a new key-pair for a certificate. The response shall contain a signing request that a certificate authority (CA) must sign. The service should retain the private key that generated this request for installation of the certificate. The private key should not be part of the response. The private key should not be part of the response.
The type of key-pair for use with signing algorithms.

This parameter shall contain the type of key-pair for use with signing algorithms. The allowable values for this parameter shall be the strings in the 'Algorithm Name' field of the 'TPM_ALG_ID Constants' table within the 'Trusted Computing Group Algorithm Registry'.
The length of the key, in bits, if needed based on the KeyPairAlgorithm parameter value.
This parameter shall contain the length of the key, in bits, if needed based on the KeyPairAlgorithm parameter value.
The curve ID to use with the key, if needed based on the KeyPairAlgorithm parameter value.

This parameter shall contain the curve ID to use with the key, if needed based on the KeyPairAlgorithm parameter value. The allowable values for this parameter shall be the strings in the 'Name' field of the 'TPM_ECC_CURVE Constants' table within the 'Trusted Computing Group Algorithm Registry'.
The challenge password to apply to the certificate for revocation requests.
This property shall contain the challenge password to apply to the certificate for revocation requests as defined by the RFC2985 'challengePassword' attribute.
This action generates a certificate signing request by using the existing information and key-pair of the certificate.

This action shall generate a certificate signing request using the existing information and key-pair of the certificate. The response shall contain a signing request that a certificate authority (CA) must sign. The service should retain the private key that this request generates for when the certificate is installed. The private key should not be part of the response.
The challenge password to apply to the certificate for revocation requests.
This property shall contain the challenge password to apply to the certificate for revocation requests as defined by the RFC2985 'challengePassword' attribute.
The string for the certificate.

This property shall contain the certificate, and the format shall follow the requirements specified by the CertificateType property value. If the certificate contains any private keys, they shall be removed from the string in responses. If the service does not know the private key for the certificate and is needed to use the certificate, the client shall provide the private key as part of the string in the POST request.
The format of the certificate.
This property shall contain the format type for the certificate.
The issuer of the certificate.
This property shall contain an object containing information about the issuer of the certificate.
The subject of the certificate.
This property shall contain an object containing information about the subject of the certificate.
The date when the certificate becomes valid.
This property shall contain the date when the certificate validity period begins.
The date when the certificate is no longer valid.
This property shall contain the date when the certificate validity period ends.
The key usage extension, which defines the purpose of the public keys in this certificate.
This property shall contain the key usage extension, which defines the purpose of the public keys in this certificate.
The available actions for this resource.
This property shall contain the available actions for this resource.
The identifier information about a certificate.
This type shall contain the properties that identifies the issuer or subject of a certificate.
The fully qualified domain name of the entity.
This property shall contain the fully qualified domain name of the entity.
The name of the organization of the entity.
This property shall contain the name of the organization of the entity.
The name of the unit or division of the organization of the entity.
This property shall contain the name of the unit or division of the organization of the entity.
The city or locality of the organization of the entity.
This property shall contain the city or locality of the organization of the entity.
The state, province, or region of the organization of the entity.
This property shall contain the state, province, or region of the organization of the entity.
The country of the organization of the entity.
This property shall contain the two-letter ISO code for the country of the organization of the entity.
The email address of the contact within the organization of the entity.
This property shall contain the email address of the contact within the organization of the entity.
The available actions for this resource.
This type shall contain the available actions for this resource.
The available OEM-specific actions for this resource.
This property shall contain the available OEM-specific actions for this resource.
The available OEM-specific actions for this resource.
This type shall contain the available OEM-specific actions for this resource.
This version was created to force the regeneration of JSON Schema so that URI properties use the uri-reference format.
This version was created to update the CertificateString description. It was also created to update descriptions that this schema defines.
This version was created to correct various typographical errors.
This version was created to add the Renew and Rekey actions.
The response body for the Rekey action.
This type shall contain the properties found in the response body for the Rekey action.
The link to the certificate being rekeyed.
This property shall contain a link to a resource of type Certificate that is replaced after the certificate authority (CA) signs the certificate.
The string for the certificate signing request.
This property shall contain the certificate signing request as a PEM-encoded string, containing structures specified by RFC2986. The private key should not be part of the string.
The response body for the Renew action.
This type shall contain the properties found in the response body for the Renew action.
The link to the certificate being renewed.
This property shall contain a link to a resource of type Certificate that is replaced after the certificate authority (CA) signs the certificate.
The string for the certificate signing request.
This property shall contain the certificate signing request as a PEM-encoded string, containing structures specified by RFC2986. The private key should not be part of the string.
This version was created to update the CertificateString description. It was also created to update descriptions that this schema defines.
This version was created to correct various typographical errors.
The UEFI signature owner for this certificate.

The value of this property shall contain the GUID of the UEFI signature owner for this certificate as defined by the UEFI Specification. This property shall only be present for secure boot database certificates.
This version was created to correct various typographical errors.
